Comments_List: I learned a lot in this course and think I improved in both my written and oral skills. I've learned to be more comfortable incorporating new vocabulary words and new syntax into speaking Chinese. I also learned a lot about Chinese culture and its history.
More in-depth understanding of Chinese culture, technical grammatical skills, extensive vocabulary regarding the arts and abstract concepts
Developed Chinese Language skills, learned new vocabulary and new sentence structures
The course is very rigorous, but I think that is essential to improving in Chinese.

Strengths: Wang lao shi
Weaknesses: Lessons from the textbook were far easier than the lessons that Wang laoshi wrote herself

Meeting every day means the vocabulary is always fresh in your mind, and also gives you a great chance to practice the words in context. On the other hand, the frequent vocabulary tests also demanded that you learn a large number of new words every day, and it often was hard to remember the words we had covered for midterm exams. Perhaps an increased emphasis on the projects and creative usages of words would help both increase class involvement as well as aid in the learning of new words.
Absolutely! This was my favorite class at Yale to date. Intellectually stimulating and course work load is high, but definitely worth it.
This is a great course for anybody with an interest in Chinese, and who wishes to further their abilities in the language.
